page.title: 12THE SEWAGE WORKS
page.content: The Hazelwood Lane Sewage Works was opened in 1956 and deals with 3.5 million gallons of domestic and industrial waste a day from the Bracknell area. 18 people are employed at the works: 6 staff members, 4 operators & 8 fitters. STAGES IN TREATMENT 1.Sewage passes through an inlet into channels where the grit falls to the bottom. 2.Primary Sedimentation. This is where the sludge is collected. After treatment it is used as a fertiliser and the methane produced is used as a fuel.The water is then poured onto media rocks in tanks 6 feet deep. 3.Secondary Sedimentation. The remainder of the sludge falls to the bottom. The water then passes through micro-mesh before joining a nearby tributary of the River Thames.
